DataElement.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Neoplasm Volume Milliliter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the volume (length x width x height) in cubic centimeters of a lesion as visualized by Positron Emission Transmission (PET) scan.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Volume value for a nodule detected through medical imaging._An abnormal tissue growth resulted from uncontrolled cell proliferation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: A publication that is one of a set of several similar publications.

Concepts.definition: A publication that is one of a set of several similar publications.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container._A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.:A measure of volume for a liquid.  A milliliter is approximately 950 times smaller than a quart and 30 times smaller than a fluid ounce.  A milliliter of liquid and a cubic centimeter (cc) of liquid are the same.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support the Virginia Commonwealth University (VCU) adoption of C3D
